spans.text: As she pushed the door open, the temperature difference made Taki pause for a moment.
Perhaps it was an illusion, or maybe it was real—it felt like the sudden discomfort she had experienced earlier was starting to build again.
Her breathing grew increasingly rapid, and her heart raced painfully.
Forcing herself, step by step, she made her way to the dining table. Her hands gripped the back of a chair tightly, but her entire body could no longer stand upright.
Gasping for breath, she collapsed to her knees. An unprecedented sense of danger swept over her, and her instincts told her she absolutely must not fall asleep like this.
(This is bad... My phone, where’s my phone…?)
She desperately pulled out her phone, but her hands trembled uncontrollably, unable to even unlock the screen.
The phone slipped out of her hand, and with it, her whole body collapsed heavily to the ground.
Her drooping eyelids finally closed over her eyes. Taki’s already blurred vision faded completely as her consciousness continued to stretch into the endless darkness.
